content:
• Monday, June 25, 2018
  • SCG

    Dow utilities cap best eight-day stretch in more than two years

    • The utilities sector provided an island of prosperity amid an ocean of losses in today's trade, rallying to a two-month high and its best eight-session stretch in more than two years.
    • The Dow Jones utilities index has climbed 6.3% during the streak in the best eight-day percentage gain since rallying 6.5% during an eight-day stretch that ended in February 2016.
    • In today's trade: SCG +3.7%, FE +3.1%, AEP +2.5%, NI +2.4%, DTE +2.3%, ED +2.2%, DUK +2.1%, PPL +1.9%, WEC +1.8%, SO +1.7%, PEG +1.7%, AEE +1.6%, D +1.4%, NEE +1.3%, SRE +1.3%, ETR +1%, EIX +1%, EXC +0.8%.
    • ETFs: XLU, UTG, VPU, GUT, IDU, BUI, FUTY, RYU, UPW, PSCU, FXU, SDP, PUI, FUGAX, JHMU, BUYN, UTLF, XU
     
     
     
     
    | 7:53 PM | 64 Comments
  • GTN

    Moody's eyes ratings cut for Gray Television on new debt

    • Gray Television (NYSE:GTN) may face a ratings cut from Moody's after the company's transformative $3.6B deal for Raycom Media.
    • Moody's expects ratings on Gray's term loans and unsecured notes will come under pressure in a pro forma capital structure heavier on secured debt, and leverage ratio will likely remain high for the rating category.
    • Gray rose 16% during the market session today to end up at its highest point since Feb. 12.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 7:03 PM | 2 Comments
  • NFLX

    Netflix marks worst decline in years

    • Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX), a relatively high-beta stock, took today's market decline particularly hard, down 6.5%.
    • That fall of $26.61 comes amid its worst intraday decline in nearly two years; it shaved some $11.5B off the company's market cap.
    • It's the third straight decline for the stock.
    • Late Friday, the company's chief communications officer said he was departing the company after incidents of insensitive comments came to light and were addressed by CEO Reed Hastings.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM | 98 Comments
  • RNGR

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (06/25/2018)

    • Top gainers: RNGR +2.7%. GWPH +2.3%. TSG +1.6%. HUYA +1.6%. CVGI +1.6%.
    • Top Losers: TVIX -4.1%. VIIX -1.9%.  HAIR -1.8%. CVNA -1.3%. GG -1.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 6 Comments
  • CPRT

    EXEL +5.4% on move to MidCap 400; CPRT to S&P 500

    • Online auction provider Copart (NASDAQ:CPRT) is up 0.5% after hours as it's making a move to the S&P 500, to take the place of Dr Pepper Snapple.
    • When Dr Pepper Snapple (NYSE:DPS-OLD) merges with Keurig Green Mountain to become Keurig Dr Pepper (NYSE:KDP), its Investable Weight Factor (measuring the percentage of free float available to the public) will fall below 50%, the minimum threshold required to be included in the S&P 500.
    • Meanwhile, biotech firm Exelixis (NASDAQ:EXEL) is up 5.4% in late trading, moving into the MidCap 400 to take the spot vacated by Copart.
    • Those moves are effective prior to the open of trading on Monday, July 2.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM | 14 Comments
  • SENS

    Senseonics -5.8% on $80M public share offering

    • Senseonics Holdings (NYSEMKT:SENS) is off 5.8% after hours after announcing a public offering of $80M worth of common stock.
    • The offering is set to come at $4.05/share, Bloomberg notes; shares had closed today at $4.66 and are quoting at $4.43 after hours.
    • Underwriters will get a 30-day option to buy up to an additional $12M worth.
    • Senseonics is selling all shares in the offering.
    • BTIG is sole book-runner.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:15 PM | 30 Comments
  • CBIO

    Catalyst Bio +3.1% as Point72 discloses 5.5% passive stake

    • Catalyst Biosciences (NASDAQ:CBIO) shareholder Point72 and Steven Cohen have reported a 5.5% stake in the company.
    • The 13G filing indicates a passively held stake of 651,000 shares -- a little over $7.06M worth at current pricing.
    • Shares have ticked up 3.1% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM
  • SNSS

    Sunesis +1.9% on $15.5M repurchase agreement

    • Sunesis Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SNSS) enters a repurchase program of up to $15.5M shares with Aspire Capital Fund.
    • Under the agreement, Aspire Capital has made an initial investment by purchasing $500K worth of common shares at $2.19/share.
    • Aspire Capital commits to purchasing up to an additional $15M of common shares at the request of Sunesis during a 24-month period. 
    • Sunesis Pharmaceuticals shares are up 1.9% aftermarket to $2.15.  
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM
  • CIDM

    Cinedigm reports Q4 results

    • Cinedigm (NASDAQ:CIDM): Q4 net income of $0.046M
    • Revenue of $17.64M (-10.0% Y/Y)
    • Shares +13.16%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • HRTX

    Heron Therapeutics -2.7% on $200M stock offering

    • Heron Therapeutics (NASDAQ:HRTX) announces a public offering of $200M of common stock. Initial purchasers get a 30-day option for up to $30M of additional shares.
    • Heron Therapeutics shares are down 2.7% aftermarket to $40.35.  
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 3 Comments
  • ERYP

    Erytech Pharma -29% after stopping development of key drug

    • Erytech Pharma (ERYP -29.2%) plunges to a record low after saying it will stop its development program for its eryaspase product candidate in acute lymphoblastic leukemia.
    • Citing feedback from regulatory agencies in Europe and the U.S., ERYP says significant additional investment would be required in order to seek approval of eryaspase for the treatment of ALL.
    • The company says it will instead focus its development efforts for eryaspase on the potential treatment of selected solid tumor indications.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 3 Comments
  • RUBI

    Rubicon, Criteo drop after AT&T confirms purchase of ad platform

    • The Rubicon Project (NYSE:RUBI) drops 9.6% to $2.27 and Criteo (NASDAQ:CRTO) drops 1.1% to $33.48 after AT&T confirms its acquisition of ad platform AppNexus. 
    • Previously: AT&T seals deal for AppNexus (June 25)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • HZO

    MarineMax -14% as Brunswick's Sea Ray restructure adds uncertainty

    • MarineMax (HZO -14%) plunges following Brunswick's (BC -3.3%) failure to sell its Sea Ray division and decision to discontinue Sea Ray's yacht and sport yacht business, which prompts Craig Hallum to downgrade HZO to Hold from Buy with a $22 price target, cut from $27, saying news adds "risk and uncertainty" for the company.
    • HZO is the world's largest retailer of Sea Ray boats, historically representing more than 50% of Sea Ray’s worldwide sales, and the Sea Ray brand accounted for 23% of its FY 2017 revenue, but CEO William McGill says the company's brand and product diversification will allow it to replace the Sea Ray sport yacht and yacht revenue.
    • Given the "crucial importance" of Sea Ray to HZO's business, Craig-Hallum says it is prudent to step to the sidelines pending better visibility on BC's intention.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • PTE

    PolarityTE gets support from Cantor Fitzgerald; shares still -28%

    • PolarityTE (COOL -28.6%) is reiterated with an Overweight rating and $65 price target at Cantor Fitzgerald after attending a company-sponsored event and hearing three surgeons describe their clinical experiences using SkinTE and views on the transformative potential of the wound regeneration product.
    • The firm thinks COOL is positioned long-term to "redefine the treatment landscape for wound regeneration," and says today's stock plunge may be caused by the market's misunderstanding of the company's IP strategy and interaction with the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office.
    • Cantor's note does not mention Citron Research, which today accused COOL of fraud in its promotion of patents to investors.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM | 11 Comments
  • BOXL

    Boxlight completes the acquisition of Qwizdom

    • Boxlight (BOXL -5%) acquired Qwizdom for cash, debt and common stock valued at ~$2.5M.
    • Qwizdom develops software and hardware solutions that are quick to implement and designed to increase participation, provide immediate data feedback, and, most importantly, accelerate and improve comprehension and learning.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM
  • AMZN

    RBC analyst says Amazon could double Whole Foods business in 5 to 10 years

    • RBC analyst Mark Mahaney says Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) could double Whole Food’s customer base.
    • During an appearance on CNBC, Mahaney said that if Amazon had 60M to 70M U.S. Prime customers, about 20M to 30M live near a Whole Foods but “don’t regularly shop there.” 
    • Mahaney continues that Amazon “could double, theoretically, Whole Foods overall customer base over a 5 to 10 year period just by giving financial incentives to Prime customers.” 
    • Mahaney has an Outperform rating on Amazon with a $1,900 price target, a 10% upside to Friday’s close.   
    • Amazon shares are down 3.7% to $1,651.74.    
    • Previously: Amazon roundup: Whole Foods discounts nationwide, fired workers can now appeal (June 25)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 20 Comments
  • FCX

    Copper hits nearly three-month low on U.S.-China trade tension

    • Copper prices tumbled to their lowest close in nearly three months, settling -1.3% at $2.992/lb. to cap a ~10% drop from a peak earlier this month.
    • There is “concern globally about what trade wars mean for metals,” says Nitesh Shah, director of research at WisdomTree. “Over the last couple of weeks or so, people have been thinking of the impact as a very negative thing for industrial metals.”
    • Traders are betting that the likelihood of a negotiated solution that avoids tariffs has become more distant, potentially hurting global growth and damping demand for industrial metals such as copper: China consumes ~50% of the world’s copper.
    • Copper traders also are watching labor negotiations at two copper mines controlled by Chile's Codelco - including the Chuquicamata mine, home to one of the world’s largest copper deposits - that potentially could reduce supply.
    • Major global metals producers are sharply lower: FCX -5.4%, BHP -3%, RIO -2.8%, VALE -2.7%, TECK -6.3%, SCCO -1.6%, AA -4.1%.
    • ETFs: JJC, CPER, CUPM
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 11 Comments
  • ABIL

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 PM (06/25/2018)

    • Gainers: ABIL +84%. TSRI +39%. OTCPK:LFIN +8%. IDN +7%. CBAK-OLD +7%.
    • Losers: CLPS -12%. MYSZ -11%. RMNI -11%. WUBA -11%. RUBI -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • S

    Sprint's Claure, T-Mobile's Legere heading to Congress

    • Top leaders of the nation's No. 3 and No. 4 wireless carriers will appear on Capitol Hill this week to speak on the merits of their proposed merger.
    • Sprint's (S -2.9%) Marcelo Claure and T-Mobile (TMUS -2%) chief John Legere will appear at a Wednesday "Game of Phones" hearing of the Senate Judiciary's Subcommittee on Antitrust, Competition Policy, and Consumer Rights, the panel says.
    • Intel tech VP Asha Keddy is also set to appear, the panel says.
    • T-Mobile officially filed its Public Interest Statement with the FCC in favor of its $26.5B merger deal last week.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM | 15 Comments
  • LGCYO

    Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (06/25/2018)

    • Gainers: LGCYO +35%. LGCYP +19%. GEVO +15%. PEIX +9%. AMID +7%.
    • Losers: CELP -10%. MBII -8%. AMTX -7%. CSTM -7%. LGCY -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 2 Comments
  • BA

    Boeing -2% despite $5.6B Dreamliner order; Barclays still a believer

    • Boeing (BA -2.3%) is the day's biggest decliner on the Dow despite winning a commitment from Vietnamese startup air carrier Bamboo Airways to buy 20 787-9 Dreamliners in a deal that could worth $5.6B at list prices.
    • BA says Bamboo completed the deposit requirement to reserve the 20 planes, which are tentatively scheduled to deliver from April 2020 through 2021.
    • Barclays analyst David Strauss overlooks the tariff worries that have weighed on BA shares, reiterating an Overweight rating and $400 price target, saying the company is still in the "early days of benefiting from a heightened focus on cost reduction and improved productivity" that will boost margins and free cash flow.
    • Strauss forecasts Boeing will record more than $30/share in free cash flow in 2020, including $5B in free cash flow from prepayments in 2018, more than double the $2B YTD and above last year's $4.5B.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM | 14 Comments
  • CBS

    CBS extends NFL streaming deal through 2022, adds mobile access

    • CBS (CBS -1.8%) has extended its streaming deal with the NFL, allowing for all NFL on CBS games to be streamed on CBS All Access through the 2022 season.
    • It's also extended rights to include mobile devices beginning this season, for CBS All Access subscribers and TV Everywhere viewers who are authenticated by their pay TV providers.
    • CBS started streaming NFL on CBS games to its All Access subs in 2016 for connected TVs, tablets and computers.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • MU

    Semiconductor stocks drop on reported investment restrictions on China

    • Semiconductor stocks are taking a beating today after early morning reports and U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin’s response tweet about reported investment restrictions on China.
    • Mnuchin’s tweet: "On behalf of @realDonaldTrump, the stories on investment restrictions in Bloomberg & WSJ are false, fake news. The leaker either doesn’t exist or know the subject very well. Statement will be out not specific to China, but to all countries that are trying to steal our technology."  
    • The Philadelphia Semiconductor Index is down 3.7%.    
    • Semiconductors stocks on the move: Micron (MU -7%), Nvidia (NVDA -5.7%), Marvell (MRVL -5.6%), AMD (AMD -5.5%), ON Semiconductors (ON -5.2%), ASML (ASML -5%), Cypress Semiconductors (CY -4.9%), Monolith Power (MPWR -4.2%), Intel (INTC -4.2%), MKS Instruments (MKSI -4.1%), Cree (CREE -3.8%), Cavium (CAVM -3.8%), Teradyne (TER -3.6%), Applied Materials (AMAT -3.7%), Silicon Motion (SIMO -3.5%), Microchip (MCHP -3.7%), Maxim (MXIM -3.6%), Integrated Device (IDTI -3.5%), Lam Research (LRCX -3.1%), Texas Instruments (TXN -3%), Qualcomm (QCOM -2.9%), Xilinx (XLNX -2.7%), Qorvo (QRVO -2.5%), Analog Devices (ADI -2%), and InterDigital (IDCC -2.1%). 
    • Previously: Nomura downgrades Intel on CEO search; INTC -2.3% (June 25)
    • Previously: Futures fall as Trump targets Chinese investment (June 25)
    • Previously: Nasdaq tumbles 2%; Mnuchin clarifies on China tech crackdown (June 25)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM | 229 Comments
  • WFT

    Weatherford targeted by activist investor, says CEO 'woefully inadequate'

    • Weatherford International (WFT -3.2%) is being targeted by activist investor Q Investments, which has taken a small stake in the company and urges the board to sell assets or the entire company before its “over-levered capital structure” destroy “what remaining value the shareholders have left," Financial Times reports.
    • Q's stake in WFT is just 0.02% but the fund believes other investors also are unhappy about the company’s performance and will join its campaign for change; shares have slipped 16% over the past 12 months, while peers Halliburton and Schlumberger have gained 10% and 2%, respectively.
    • Q says “the current dilapidated financial condition of the company” masks WFT's “underlying strong portfolio of businesses and technologies," and that efforts by CEO Mark McCollum to reverse the company’s performance are “woefully inadequate."
    • The fund is not yet calling for new board members but says it is “incomprehensible” that six directors who were in place during the tenure of previous CEO Bernard Duroc-Danner are still on the board.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM | 6 Comments
  • XENE

    Xenon Pharma +3.9% as Potiga gets orphan drug status

    • Xenon Pharmaceuticals (XENE +3.9%) has won orphan drug status for its Potiga (ezogabine) in the treatment of KCNQ2 epileptic encephalopathy.
    • That designation came on Thursday.
    • It could mean seven years' exclusivity if approved for a rare disease.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • DGX

    Quest Diagnostics moves up as Barclays upgrades to Overweight

    • Quest Diagnostics (DGX +2.5%) is higher after Barclays upgrades shares to Overweight from Equal Weight and raises its price target to $130 from $120, saying the new payor paradigm accelerates opportunities for lab consolidation and new data service opportunities.
    • Barclays believes it could be a big deal that UnitedHealth (UNH -1.1%) will share savings with preferred labs as volume shifts from high-cost settings, a first for the lab industry.
    • The firm says its primary care physician survey shows both Quest and LabCorp (LH -0.3%) should gain share as payor networks open.
    • Barclays also says potential changes in benefit design could include new incentives for both physicians and patients to drive volumes toward preferred labs, which would align all parties to drive value for the healthcare system.
    • Finally, the firm thinks the pieces are in place for Quest to more meaningfully leverage its diagnostic data asset with customers.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM
  • SYBX

    Synlogic offers new Synthetic Biologic preclinical data

    • Synlogic (SYBX -8.2%) has offered up new preclinical data from its Synthetic Biotic oncology program.
    • The data show that intra-tumorally injected E. coli Nissle -- used as the parent strain for Synthetic Biotic medicines -- has the ability to colonize and persist in tumors, and that multiple functions can be engineered into a single bacterial strain.
    • That points to using the Syntheic Biotic approach to potentially treat solid tumors, including "cold" tumors resitant to current immunotherapies.
    • The data also demonstrate using "switches" to direct functions in the medicines in response to environmental cues or exogenously administered small molecules.
    • A second presentation covered mouse tumor model studies where one engineered strain lowered levels of kynurenine metabolite by degrading it.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM
  • GWPH

    FDA approves first cannabis-based drug

    • The FDA approves GW Pharma’s (NASDAQ:GWPH) Epidiolex to treat rare childhood seizures.
    • Epidiolex is the first US-approved cannabinoid and the drug could achieve $1.2B in sales by 2022, according to Clarivate data. 
    • The potential approval was previously reported by the FT. 
    • GW Pharma shares are down 1.2% to $149.38.  
    • Previously: First U.S. approval of cannabis-based drug (June 25)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM | 23 Comments

    • Gainers: HX +12%. HGSH +6%. SAR +5%.
    • Losers: YRD -10%. FUNC -8%. SIEB -7%. SUPV -7%. XRF -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM | 1 Comment

    Midday Gainers / Losers (06/25/2018)

    • Gainers: XRM +100%. XBIO +96%. YECO-OLD +69%. ABIL +66%. TSRI +33%. LGCYO +32%. ATV +31%. CADC +20%. LGCYP +18%. VLRX +17%.
    • Losers: SPHS -41%. MACK -39%. COOL -32%. LIVX -20%. OCX -16%. SLNO -14%. CDNA -14%. NYMX -13%. CLPS -13%. CFRX -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • PTE

    PolarityTE -28% after Citron accuses fraud

    • PolarityTE (COOL -28.4%) plunges after Citron Research accuses the company of fraud in raising money based on a patent application that was rejected earlier this month, and says the SEC should launch an investigation.
    • The SEC should halt trading in COOL shares "immediately before insiders are allowed to enrich themselves even more as the company continues to deceive investors," Citron says.
    • "A group of serial stock promoters" have profited without properly disclosing their receipt of a notice of non-final rejection of the company's critical patent, according to Citron.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM | 21 Comments
  • SLDB

    Sarepta DMD treatment gets orphan drug designation

    • Sarepta (SRPT -4%) confirms its gene therapy treatment for Duchenne muscular dystrophy has gotten orphan drug designation at the FDA.
    • That gets it years of market exclusivity if approved.
    • Shares had jumped a week ago based on preliminary data from the treatment candidate.
    • Solid Biosciences (NASDAQ:SLDB) is up 6.7% currently after seeing analyst praise today for its DMD therapy.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM | 8 Comments
  • CMT

    Consumer - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 PM (06/25/2018)

    • Gainers: CMT +13%. CPB +10%. PETZ +9%. PME +9%. DLA +8%.
    • Losers: EAST -8%. CXDC -8%. CELH -7%. KODK -7%. FORK -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM | 7 Comments
  • MSFT

    Atlantic Equities sees Microsoft Azure topping $100B in revenue in 10 years

    • Atlantic Equities analyst James Cordwell rates Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) at Overweight with a $125 price target, a 24% upside to Friday’s close.
    • Cordwell says Azure has replaced Windows as Microsoft’s key enterprise offering. The analyst expects Azure to hit $115B in revenue in the next decade compared to $185B for AWS. 
    • Microsoft shares are down 1.9% to $98.49.        
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM | 15 Comments
  • SFTBY

    Nikkei: SoftBank mobile unit to file for IPO soon as July

    • SoftBank (SFTBY -3.4%) will apply to list its Japanese mobile unit in Tokyo as soon as next month, Nikkei reports.
    • And the unit could debut on Tokyo's first section by the end of the year.
    • That would provide capital that SoftBank covets to accelerate its transition into technology investing. While the home wireless business isn't a growth driver, it generates annual cash flow of about ¥500B (about $4.56B) and posted operating profit of about ¥680B ($6.18B) for the year ended in March.
    • Previously: SoftBank CEO wants to focus on late-stage investments, unicorns (Jun. 20 2018)
    • Previously: FT: SoftBank to add $5B to Vision Fund for employees (Jun. 19 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM | 5 Comments
  • XBIO

    Xenetic Biosciences doubles up on heavy volume

    • Shares in nanocap Xenetic Biosciences (NASDAQ:XBIO) are surging today, up 100% to $5.63.
    • At just under 6M shares traded, volume is running more than 36 times average.
    • The company's lead product candidate is XBIO-101, a small molecule immunomodulator and interferon inducer focused on treating progesterone-resistant endometrial cancer.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 1 Comment
  • SLDB

    Solid Biosciences +7.6% amid analyst praise for DMD approach

    • Solid Biosciences (NASDAQ:SLDB) is up 7.6% and hitting record intraday highs following its January IPO, after a pair of new bullish price targets.
    • Nomura/Instinet has reiterated a Buy based on Solid Bio's potential as a second source in Duchenne muscular dystrophy. It's raised its price target to $57.
    • Meanwhile, Chardan has a Street-high target of $60 (implying 33% upside) as it sees potential breakthroughs (and a market appearance as soon as 2021) for the company's AAV-based gene therapy. Early results from Sarepta, Pfizer and SLDB support using microdystrophin in DMD, the firm says while urging caution on the data. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Shares in SLDB are up 86% since IPO.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM | 1 Comment
  • NTNX

    William Blair analyst comments on Nutanix partner contract, federal momentum

    • William Blair analyst Jason Ader says his conversations with a Nutanix (NASDAQ:NTNX) channel partner indicate the partner won a $45M Air Force deal late last month.
    • Ader expects Nutanix to get a $30M to $35M portion “split between product revenue and a five-year services agreement.” 
    • Ader also believes this was Nutanix’s “largest single deal” ever, which shows “tremendous momentum” in the federal vertical. 
    • Nutanix shares are down 6.1% to $51.03.  
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM | 17 Comments
  • MET

    MetLife charged with fraud by Massachusetts: Reuters

    • MetLife (NYSE:MET)  -1.8% after it's  charged with fraud by Massachusetts securities regulator over failure to make pension payments, Reuters reports.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM | 6 Comments

  • Nasdaq tumbles 2%; Mnuchin clarifies on China tech crackdown

    • Global markets were sent reeling early this morning on reports the Trump administration was set to bar Chinese companies from investing in U.S. technology and block tech exports to that country.
    • Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin is on the wires, calling those reports "false, fake news." Any administration moves, he says, would not be specific to China, but instead target any country trying to steal U.S. technology.
    • The Nasdaq (NASDAQ:QQQ) is now at session lows, off just over 2%. The S&P 500 (NYSEARCA:SPY) and Dow (NYSEARCA:DIA) are each lower by 1.4%.
    • Late in the session in Europe, the Stoxx 600 (NYSEARCA:FEZ) is down 1.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM | 144 Comments
  • SIEB

    Siebert -5% on day it joins Russell 3000 Index

    • Siebert Financial (NASDAQ:SIEB) falls 5.2%  on volume of 23,113 shares, a little more than half its three-month average daily volume of 41, 785.
    • Drop occurs on the same day it joins the Russell 3000 Index as part of the index's annual reconstitution.
    • No major news to account for the decline.
    • The stock reached its 52-week low of $3.60 on Nov. 16 and its 52-week high of $21.61 on Dec. 20.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • CDMO

    Avid Bioservices +8.5% on bullish start at Janney

    • Avid Bioservices (NASDAQ:CDMO) is up 8.5% after getting a Street-high price target of $10 from Janney, starting the company at Buy.
    • That implies 163% upside from today's already higher price.
    • Analyst Paul Knight says the company has more than tripled its number of customers in the past 12-18 months and has a number of catalysts ahead, including customer wins and therapeutic approvals. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Shares are down 9% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM | 2 Comments
  • LGCY

    Legacy Reserves to settle class action lawsuits, convert preferred units

    • Legacy Reserves (LGCY -7.8%) says it entered into a memorandum of understanding to settle class action lawsuits in the Delaware Chancery Court.
    • As a result, LGCY agrees to convert each outstanding 8% Series A Preferred Unit into the right to receive ~2.92 common shares of New Legacy and convery each outstanding 8% Series B Preferred Unit into the right to receive ~2.9 common shares of New Legacy (~27.6M total shares).
    • LGCYO +37.2%, LGCYP +21.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 50 Comments
  • XBIO

    Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 AM (06/25/2018)

    • Gainers: XBIO +92%. VLRX +32%. ZFGN +14%. INNT +13%. SLDB +9%.
    • Losers: SPHS -42%. MACK -35%. OTC:ZOM -16%. SLNO -11%. CHRS -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • AXP

    American Express +2% as Supreme court rules in its favor on antitrust case

    • American Express (AXP +2.1%) didn't violate federal antitrust laws with restraints the credit card company places on merchants, the U.S. Supreme Court ruled.
    • At issue is American Express's rules that prevent merchants who accept its cards from encouraging consumers to use other credit cards that cost the merchants less in fees.
    • The court ruled 5-4 in AXP's favor.
    • The Obama administration and a group of states filed the lawsuit against AXP in 2010.
    • Previously: Online retail rattled by Supreme Court ruling (June 21)

  • FSLR

    First Solar upgraded to Buy at BAML on 'most bullish' IRS interpretation

    • First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) +3.8% premarket as BofA Merrill Lynch upgrades shares to Buy from Neutral with a $63 price target, citing latest IRS tax guidance allowing as much as a four-year ITC extension on solar projects, which analyst Julien Dumoulin-Smith says was "the most bullish interpretation IRS could have released."
    • The IRS guidance is likely worth at least $50B to his prior cumulative capex expectations for the sector through 2023, Dumoulin-Smith says; although less confident of a module price recovery, he sees prospects for more U.S.-bound projects.
    • Credit Suisse said Friday that the IRS ruling is positive for solar developers with a strong pipeline, including FSLR and NextEra Energy (NYSE:NEE), while the impact on residential and distributed generators should be relatively smaller given shorter construction times but still positive for Sunrun (NASDAQ:RUN), SunPower (NASDAQ:SPWR) and Vivint Solar (NYSE:VSLR); the ruling is seen as negative for solar manufacturers such as Jinko Solar (NYSE:JKS), JA Solar (NASDAQ:JASO) and Canadian Solar (NASDAQ:CSIQ).
    • ETFs: TAN, KWT

  • HOG

    Harley-Davidson sees EU tariffs adding $2,200 to average motorcycle cost

    • Harley-Davidson (NYSE:HOG) -2.7% premarket after saying it expects European Union tariffs will add ~$2,200 to the cost of the average motorcycle exported from the U.S. to the EU.
    • But HOG says it will not raise retail prices or wholesale prices to dealers to cover the costs of the tariffs, because it "believes the tremendous cost increase, if passed onto its dealers and retail customers, would have an immediate and lasting detrimental impact to its business in the region, reducing customer access to Harley-Davidson products and negatively impacting the sustainability of its dealers’ businesses."
    • HOG expects the tariffs to cost $30M-$45M over the rest of this year and could cost $90M-$100M on a full-year basis.
    • HOG plans to shift production of motorcycles for EU destinations from the U.S. to its international facilities to avoid the tariff burden; it expects the ramp-up will require incremental investment and could take at least 9-18 months to be fully complete.
    • Earlier: Harley-Davidson says EU tariffs likely to cause price hikes this fall (June 22)
